question: Which country houses "Matsalu National Park"?
explanation: Matsalu National Park, also known as Matsalu Nature Reserve is a Ramsar Wetland located in Estonia. This national park houses Matsalu Bay, Kasari River Delta. Matsalu Bay is one of the most important wetland areas in Europe, due to its prime position on the "East Atlantic Flyway", which is an important migrate route and a staging area used by about 90 million birds annually. These national park hosts several endangered species in the IUCN Red list such as white-tailed eagles, the natterjack toad etc.
